page.title: 19Farming in Llangybi
page.content: Most of the farms in Llangybi belong to the Llangybi Castle Estate,owned by the Addams Williams family who have been squires of Llangybi for centuries.The Estate comprises approximately 2,000 acres,including woodland,several farms,houses and cottages.The land is a mixture of grade three and four.The riverside fields are free draining land but ard liable to flooding from the river Usk,which limits their use for grazing livestock.farmers receive flood warnings from the police station in Usk which is a great help.The land rises above the village and is slightly heavier.Most of farms have a dairy herd of Friesian cows as the main enterprise.Some of the larger farms also have beef cattle and sheep and also grow corn .
